metadata.title: CVE-2022-3238 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: A double-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s NTFS3 subsystem in how auser triggers remount and umount simultaneously. This flaw allows a localuser to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
linux-aws package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gke package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
linux-intel package in noble is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
linux-raspi-realtime package in realtime/noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-realtime package in realtime/noble is affected and needs fixing.
